result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwight C Wicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 2 months in the House of Correction as to count 2,  with credit for 1 day served. Sentences are concurrent with each other but consecutive to the defendant's felony case. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
- Court imposed 180 days condition time.  The court ordered the defendant to serve 120 days forthwith.  The remaining 60 days is stayed pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  Court willl consider modifying the no contact order only after the defendant completes 1/2 of his batterer's treatment.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is scheduled for a jury trial today.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
.
Plea hearing proceeded...
.
As to both counts:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing adjourned to Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
State's motion for joinder argued and granted by the court.
Court advised defendant that the offer is revoked. Case remains set for jury trial in Br. 36 on 08/24/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
Final pre-trial on August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks NOT in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance WAVIED. Case called at request of Branch 36 to address scheduling issue. Case set for Final Pretrial on 8/11/2015, branch 36 not in session that day. Court VACATED Final Pretrial date, matter rescheduled before branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference.  Discussion regarding joinder of case with 15CF382 for trial.  Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trail dates. Parties to address issue of joinder at Final Pretrial date. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with Attorney Andrew R Rider, appearing as a friend of the court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-099
Defendant has a case pending in Branch 23.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23 for a status Conference.
